item.title: tomstafford
item.description: Do grant proposal texts matter for funding decisions? A field experimenthttps://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11192-024-04968-7Simsek et al (2024) conduct a randomised experiment on top of panel review of NWO's 2018 Vidi funding round. (using a shadow panel). "We find that withholding [full] proposal texts from panelists did not detectibly impact their proposal rankings."#metaresearch #metascience #research brief comments followüßµ 1/

item.title: Boules de Fourrure
item.description:
Je suis quadra, blanc, mari√©, avec des enfants pr√© ado et adolescents.
Je suis v√©t√©rinaire, j'emploie 7 personnes, j'ai un revenu √©lev√©.
Le 30 juin et le 7 juillet je voterai NFP, parce que nous sommes en d√©mocratie et que je veux y rester.
Je veux des services publics forts, une secu qui fonctionne, la retraite plus jeune. Je veux une France qui prot√®ge les plus fragiles, et qui cesse de les accuser de tout ce qui ne va pas alors que les plus riches appauvrissent notre soci√©t√©.

item.title: Carl T. Bergstrom
item.description: There‚Äôs a common story that, loosely speaking, the replication crisis occurs when publication bias and questionable research practices fill the literature with false positives. That story motivates a lot of science reform efforts ‚Äî and it‚Äôs wrong. We explain why in our new (well, extensively rewritten) preprint:https://osf.io/preprints/socarxiv/rkyf7(I'll try to expand this into a proper thread soon.)

item.title: Renaud Chaput
item.description: So a few months ago we learned that the individual running polyfill.io silently sold the service to an obscure chinese company.This popular (and well done / very useful) service was created by the Financial Times, who stopped maintaining it and "donated it to the community", meaning that it relied on a few volunteers to continue running it (and on Fastly who provided the hosting for free). 1/7
